meanings.definition: Crumbier (comparative form of crumb): containing more crumbs
meanings.sent1: The cake was crumbier than the cookie.
meanings.sent2: The crumbier bread made a mess on the table.
meanings.sent3: I tried to clean up the crumbier mess, but it kept falling apart.
meanings.sent4: The crumbier soil in the garden was perfect for planting seeds.
meanings.sent5: The crumbier pie crust was so delicate, it crumbled at the touch.

meanings.definition: Crumbier (comparative form of crumbly): more likely to break into small pieces
meanings.sent1: The crumbier cookie fell apart as soon as I picked it up.
meanings.sent2: The crumbier sandcastle collapsed with a gentle breeze.
meanings.sent3: The crumbier crackers were so fragile, they broke in my backpack.
meanings.sent4: The crumbier ice was a challenge to skate on without falling.
meanings.sent5: The crumbier paper tore easily when I tried to fold it.
